choices.B: Only the minimum connection value is increased to 3000.
choices.C: The minimum connection value is changed to 2000.
choices.A: The minimum value increases to 3000 and the maximum value increases to 4000.

questions.question_text:
The mysqld instance has the connection control plugin enabled with these settings: connection_control_min_connection_delay=1000 connection_control_max_connection_delay=2000
The minimum and maximum delays need to be increased to 3000 and 5000, respectively.
A command is executed:
mysql> SET GLOBAL connection_control_min_connection_delay=3000;
What is the result?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
root@localhost[(none)]> show variables like '%connection_control_max_connection_delay%';
+-----------------------------------------+-------+
| Variable_name | Value |
+-----------------------------------------+-------+
| connection_control_max_connection_delay | 2000 |
+-----------------------------------------+-------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

root@localhost[(none)]> SET GLOBAL connection_control_min_connection_delay=3000;
ERROR 1231 (42000): Variable 'connection_control_min_connection_delay' can't be set to the value of '3000'

Selected Answer: D
First Max value need to change
AB, the others need select, the last one is wrong

Selected Answer: AB
PPOC81 test_user@localhost [temp]> update t1 set c1='all' limit 1;
Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.00 sec)
Rows matched: 1 Changed: 0 Warnings: 0

choices.E: UPDATE world.country SET Name='first' ORDER BY Name LIMIT
choices.C: UPDATE world.country SET Name='new' WHERE Name='old';

choices.D: It supports the creation of incremental backups.
choices.A: It supports backing up only table structures.
choices.E: It supports backup of a remote MySQL system.
choices.B: It can perform hot or warm backups.
choices.F: It supports restoring to a remote MySQL system.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about MySQL Enterprise Backup? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
B and D

B and C. 
It doesn't do remote backups, unless you also use ssh.

choices.F: Setting transaction_allow_batching to on will improve data consistency.
choices.B: Cross-database constraints can cause database inconsistency.
choices.A: Each slave thread is responsible for updating a specific database.
choices.C: Increasing slave_parallel_workers will improve high availability.
choices.E: Setting slave_parallel_type=DATABASE won't work for circular replication; it should be set to LOGICAL_CLOCK.
choices.D: Setting slave_preserve_commit_order to on will improve data consistency.

discussion.content: B. cross database consistency can cause from with DATABASE

questions.question_text:
Four nodes are configured to use circular replication.
Examine these configuration parameters for each node:
//IMG//

Which statement is true?

choices.A: Firewall_cached_entries is the number of statements found in the query cache for users in DETECTING mode.
choices.C: Firewall_access_suspicious is the number of statements logged as suspicious for users in DETECTING mode.
choices.B: Firewall_access_denied is the number of connection attempts from prohibited hosts that are denied.
choices.D: Firewall_access_granted is the number of connections granted from whitelisted hosts.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The number of statements logged by MySQL Enterprise Firewall as suspicious for users who are in DETECTING mode.
